title: Implement Google Safe Browsing
body:
### User Story

As a user, I want to be protected from visiting known scam sites in the Status browser.

### Description

*Type*: Feature

*Summary*: This is a build on #5801. At the time, we decided to implement only MetaMask phishing detect while [discussing](https://discuss.status.im/t/3rd-party-http-services/437) the addition of more HTTP services, like Google Safe Browsing. 

After speaking with our security leads, we feel that the Google Safe Browsing API is a justifiable addition of HTTP reliance and risk exposure.

#### Expected behavior
The [Google Safe Browsing API](https://developers.google.com/safe-browsing/v4/) is used to check URLs navigated in the browser against Google's list of dangerous websites.

#### Actual behavior
Only MetaMask's phishing detect list is used to identify dangerous URLs.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 120.0 DAI (120.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $45,037.07 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. **Cancelled** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 3 months, 1 week from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [sounak98](https://gitcoin.co/profile/sounak98) has been approved to start work.**

Using the Lookup API, check whether the url the user is visiting is safe or not, and display the warning page accordingly.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010).
Hey @sounak98 you've  been  approved to work on this issue; please let us know if you need  any help.
@StatusSceptre I coudn't find the guide to setting up the developer's environment! It'd be great if I get any help.

https://status.im/build_status/ Does this help?
Status, a Mobile Client for Ethereum 2.0

@StatusSceptre this error shows up when running [this script](https://gist.github.com/zhy0/66d4c5eb3bcfca54be2a0018c3058931).

```
fallocate: fallocate failed: Text file busy
mkswap: error: /swapfile is mounted; will not make swapspace
swapon: /swapfile: swapon failed: Device or resource busy
mkdir: cannot create directory ‘/home/sounak/.gradle’: File exists
````
Hey @sounak98 - apologies for the delay. We've all been taking some time off for the holidays, but either @flexsurfer or @jeluard can help you when we're back online.

@sounak98 Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

Funders only: Snooze warnings for [1 day](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010?snooze=1) | [3 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010?snooze=3) | [5 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010?snooze=5) | [10 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010?snooze=10) | [100 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6398/2010?snooze=100)
@sounak98 Not sure what the script you mention is doing. I would suggest to follow our docs: it should be self sufficient.

@jeluard the doc has the link to the script. And I was getting some errors while running `make setup`.

```
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
A problem occurred configuring project ':app'.
> You have not accepted the license agreements of the following SDK components:
  [Android SDK Platform 26, Android SDK Build-Tools 26.0.2].
  Before building your project, you need to accept the license agreements and complete the installation of the missing components using the Android Studio SDK Manager.
  Alternatively, to learn how to transfer the license agreements from one workstation to another, go to http://d.android.com/r/studio-ui/export-licenses.html

* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. Run with --scan to get full insights.

* Get more help at https://help.gradle.org

BUILD FAILED in 24s
Makefile:89: recipe for target 'prepare-android' failed
make[1]: *** [prepare-android] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/sounak/Documents/work/status-im/status-react'
Error running dependency install
```

`You have not accepted the license agreements of the following SDK components:`
Looks like you have to launch android studio and accept some license.
I had accepted the license using the command `./sdkmanager --licenses`, It was still not showing the same error message. I'm looking into it.
@sounak98 Any luck ? :)

@sounak98 Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!

Yeah I've fixed that particular error, but there are a lot of other errors coming up which are becoming very difficult to fix. Running `make react-native` gives:
```
 ERROR  A non-recoverable condition has triggered.  Watchman needs your help!
The triggering condition was at timestamp=1546751095: inotify-add-watch(/home/sounak/Documents/work/st
atus-im/temp/android/app/build/generated/source/r/debug/com/horcrux/svg) -> The user limit on the tota
l number of inotify watches was reached; increase the fs.inotify.max_user_watches sysctl
All requests will continue to fail with this message until you resolve
the underlying problem.  You will find more information on fixing this at
https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/troubleshooting.html#poison-inotify-add-watch
```
There are a couple of other errors too. Is there a pre-built docker image?

I've successfully built the app, but the app stops at the welcome screen. Metro gives this error:
```
(node:6956) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Unhandled promise rejection. This error originated eithe
r by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was n
ot handled with .catch(). (rejection id: 2)
```

Do you run both the right `make watch` and `react-native start` processes?
Also `react-native log-android` might give you some more details.
No I run the `make run-android` and `make react-native` processes.
